OrderingPartyRelationId.description: Identification of the party on whose behalf the articles are delivered.

Id.description: The identification that the ordering party uses for the order.

OrderReference.description: Reference for the order used by the ordering party.

DocumentNumber.description: The number of the document (packing slip) that was created for the shipment and that is also specified/printed on the document.

ProcessingStatus.description:
Indication of the status of the order:
- N: New (order is received but it's not yet being handled)
- I: In progress (order being fullfilled)
- P: Packed (order is packed but has not yet its final status)
- S: Shipped (order has been transferred to the carrier and has been closed)
- C: Cancelled (order has been cancelled)

The status field is only included if this is configured. **Note**: differs from SHP-Exec since it's a real-time status

Id.description: The identification that the ordering party uses for the order line.

QuantityOrdered.description: The number of items of the article that must be delivered according to the submitted order.

QuantityDelivered.description: The number of items of the article that were delivered.

QuantityNotDelivered.description: The number of items of the article that were not delivered.

StockType.description:
Designation of the type of stock that was delivered. For details refer to the comment of attribute StockType in SHP interface.
- RGL
- RGLRJC

Other types assigned by Modexpress

DateTimeOfCompletion.description: Date + time on which the line was reported ready.

Id.description: The identification that the owner uses for the delivered SKU - **WMS A24**

Code.description:
A code used to recognise/identify the delivered article.
This is usually a code that is also affixed to the article as a barcode.
If several barcodes are known for the article one of these is used.

Id.description: The identification for the unit defined by Modexpress.

Code.description: The barcode that is affixed/applied to the unit.

Weight.description:
The weight of the unit expressed in grams. There are two possibilities:
- The weight is the actual weighed weight (including the packing materials). This weight can only be indicated if it has been agreed that items must be weighed in the operation.
- The weight is the calculated weight of the contents (based on the weight of individual articles in the unit). This weight can only be indicated if a weight is known for the individual articles.

Length.description: The length of the unit expressed in millimeters.

Width.description: The width of the unit expressed in millimeters.

Height.description: The height of the unit expressed in millimeters.

Carrier.description: The carrier that is responsible for transporting the package.

ShipmentCode.description: Designation of the actual transport for the order.

TrackingId.description: Track and trace identification of the unit (assigned by the carrier).

DateTimeOfCompletion.description: Date + time on which the unit was reported ready.

ReturnTrackingId.description: Track and trace identification for a return unit (assigned by the carrier).

Stocktype.description: Designation of the type of stock that is delivered. For details refer to the comment of attribute StockType in SHP interface.

Id.description: The identification that the owner uses for the delivered SKU.

LotNumber.description: The lot/batch number of the delivered SKU.

Code.description:
A code used to recognise/identify the delivered article in the unit. This is usually a code that is also affixed to the article as a barcode.
If several barcodes are known for the article one of these is used.
